name: AWS EBS snapshot is not encrypted
description:
This policy identifies Elastic Block Store (EBS) snapshots which are not encrypted. It is highly recommended to implement encryption when you are working with production data that have sensitive information, to protect from unauthorized access.

For more details:
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/EBSEncryption.html#snapshot-account-off
searchModel.query: config from cloud.resource where cloud.type = 'aws' AND api.name = 'aws-ec2-describe-snapshots' AND json.rule = snapshot.state equals completed and snapshot.encrypted is false
recommendation:
AWS EBS snapshots encryption can not be modified once it is created. You can encrypt a copy of an unencrypted snapshot. This way, you can quickly add encryption to a previously unencrypted EBS snapshot, and you can delete the reported EBS snapshot.

Follow the below steps to encrypt a copy of an unencrypted snapshot:
1. Log in to AWS console
2. Navigate to the EC2 dashboard
3. In the left navigation panel and choose 'Snapshots' under the 'Elastic Block Store' section
4. Select the reported EBS snapshot
5. Click on the 'Actions' button at the top panel and click on the 'Copy' option
6. In the 'Copy Snapshot' dialog box, select the box 'Encrypt this snapshot' next to 'Encryption' and choose the 'Master key' from the dropdown menu
7. Click on the 'Copy' button

Once an encrypted EBS snapshot created from copying the reported EBS snapshot, You can delete the reported unencrypted EBS snapshot by,
1. Log in to AWS console
2. Navigate to the EC2 dashboard
3. In the left navigation panel and choose 'Snapshots' under the 'Elastic Block Store' section
4. Select the reported EBS snapshot
5. Click on the 'Actions' button at the top panel and click on the 'Delete' option
6. In the 'Delete Snapshot' dialog box, click on 'Yes, Delete'
